meta.name: Duality of Man - Investigators Pack
meta.description:
Duality of Man is a project designed to be a spin on the classic "Main Class level 0-5, Secondary Class level 0-2" deckbuilding investigators.
Investigators in this pack all contain the same deckbuilding: 0-3 on both of their classes, and up to 3 level 4-5 cards from either of those classes along with the usual Neutral ones.
meta.author: TomásAmi

cards.back_flavor: Betty never thought her life would amount to more than endless ledgers and black ink. But when her firm was contracted to review the accounts of the Silver Twilight Lodge, she uncovered discrepancies that weren’t just financial. Funds vanishing into properties that don’t exist, names of “donors” who had been dead for decades, and entire columns of figures that seemed to shift when she looked away. Now, with her once-stable career unraveling, Betty finds herself drawn into Arkham’s shadowed streets, where the Lodge’s corruption festers like a hidden rot. She knows the numbers don’t lie, rather the opposite, for in Arkham the truth they reveal may be far worse than fraud.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-3, Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 3 level 4-5 Guardian and/or Seeker cards ([guardian]/[seeker]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 3 copies of Neat and Tidy, Compulsive, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Requirements: Your deck must contain at least 10 Guardian [guardian] and 10 Seeker [seeker] cards.
cards.flavor: Need both the original and the copy, ma'am.
cards.name: Betty Kim
cards.text:
[reaction] After you play a card: Play another copy of that card from your hand, at no cost. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If you played two or more cards with the same name this round, you automatically succeed and draw 1 card instead.

cards.name: Neat and Tidy
cards.text:
Betty Kim deck only. Fast. Play only during your turn.
Reveal a card in your hand. Search the top 5 cards of your deck another copy of that card and draw it. Return the rest to the top in any order. If this is not the first time you play Neat and Tidy this turn, draw all of them instead.

cards.flavor: "No! Wrong, wrong! Start again."
cards.name: Compulsive
cards.text:
Hidden.
Play only if Compulsive is the only non-weakness player card in your hand.
While Compulsive is in your hand, the first time you perform a play action each round, it costs 1 additional action.

cards.back_flavor: Kelly was still rather green when they sent her under. The Sheldons were supposed to be just another gang, but the assignment stretched into three long years. She played the part, climbed the ladder, and dirtied her hands more than once to keep suspicion off her back. Now she’s earned a seat at the big table and she's eating the good portion of the pie. That’s when she hears the talk of rites, symbols, and names that don’t belong in any sane tongue. The Sheldons aren’t just crooks. They’re acolytes or handlers of something bigger, nastier, and dirtier.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-3, Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 3 level 4-5 Guardian and/or Rogue cards ([guardian]/[rogue]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 2 copies of Unlikely Informant, Compromised Cover, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Requirements: Your deck must contain at least 10 Guardian [guardian] and 10 Rogue [rogue] cards.
cards.name: Kelly McNab
cards.text: [reaction] After you deal damage to an enemy but do not defeat it, choose one: (Limit once per round per choice.) - Draw. - Evade ([combat]). - Fight ([agility]). [elder_sign] effect: +2. If this test succeeds, you may deal 1 damage to an exhausted enemy at your location.

cards.name: Unlikely Informant
cards.text:
Kelly McNab deck only.
[reaction] When you play Unlikely Informant, increase its cost by 2: It gains fast. Draw 1 card.
[reaction] When you play Unlikely Informant, increase its cost by 2: Discover 1 clue at your location.
[reaction] When you play Unlikely Informant, increase its cost by 2: You get +2 [combat] and +2 [agility] until the end of the phase.

cards.name: Compromised Cover
cards.text:
Attached enemy gains +1 health, aloof, and elusive. Revelation - Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Attach Compromised Cover to that enemy and spawn it at your location. Forced - When the game ends, if attached enemy is in
play: Kelly McNab suffers 1 mental trauma.

cards.back_flavor: The Ilyin family had dabbled in the occult for generations. Prayers, rituals, and superstition were always part of Joseph’s life. He made his living as an exorcist, more interested in a quick buck than true faith, something that quickly changed the day he actually saw a spirit in one of his visitations. From that moment on, Joseph put his family’s knowledge to the test, delving into the strangest and most terrifying happenings in Arkham, offering his services as a thaumaturge.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-3, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 3 level 4-5 Guardian and/or Mystic cards ([guardian]/[mystic]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Profane Censer, Sadistic, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Requirements: Your deck must contain at least 10 Guardian [guardian] and 10 Mystic [mystic] cards.
cards.flavor: Everybody-everything-has a weakness.
cards.name: Joseph Ilyin
cards.text: [reaction] When you initiate a Fight action printed on an asset, place 1 doom on that asset: That attack deals +1 damage. Treat all damage as if it came from a Spell. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] effect: +2. Until the end of the round, ignore the limit on the above [reaction] ability.

cards.name: Profane Censer
cards.text: Joseph Ilyin deck only. [reaction] When doom would be placed on another card you control, exhaust Profane Censer: Place it on Profane Censer instead. (Consider any costs paid.) [action]: Play an asset from your hand, reducing its cost by the amount of doom on Profane Censer. Remove Profane Censer from the game.

cards.name: Sadistic
cards.text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When the game ends or you are eliminated, if Sadistic is still in your hand: You suffer 1 mental trauma. [reaction] When you deal damage to an enemy in excess of its remaining health, if you activated Joseph Ilyin's [reaction] ability on that test: Discard this card from your hand.

cards.back_flavor: For as long as he could remember, the answer to “What do you want to do when you grow up?” was always the same: firefighter. And in time, that dream was fulfilled. He has served more than twenty years in Arkham’s Fire Department, a career that gave him the chance to notice unsettling patterns behind a few of the city’s disasters. Every seven years, without fail, a massive forest fire erupts outside Arkham. This year, determined to uncover the truth, he began his own investigation. After extinguishing the fire, he discovered a half-burned scrap of paper. Its message pointed to a name he had never heard before: the "Brethren of Ash." Whoever they are, they will soon have a visitor.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-3, Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 3 level 4-5 Guardian and/or Survivor cards ([guardian]/[survivor]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Jet Strike, Put out the Fire, Can't Save Them All, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Requirements: Your deck must contain at least 10 Guardian [guardian] and 10 Survivor [survivor] cards.
cards.flavor:
Be proud! Be brave!
Be strong! Be prepared!
cards.name: Robert Scott
cards.text:
[free] Exile a level 1-5 card in your discard pile: Gain resources equal to its level. (Limit once per round.)
Resources on Robert Scott's resource pool may be spent by any investigator at his location.
[elder_sign] effect: +0. Gain 1 resource.

cards.name: Jet Strike
cards.text: Robert Scott deck only. Fight ([combat]). As an additional cost to play Jet Strike you may exile a level 0-5 card from your hand to get +X [combat], where X is that card's level. This attack deals additional damage equal to the number of cards you have exiled this game (to a maximum of +3).

cards.name: Put out the Fire
cards.text:
Robert Scott deck only. Play only as your first action.
When you play Put out the Fire add a card you have exiled this game to the victory display, and attach this card to it.
[reaction] When the game ends or you resign, if Put out the Fire is on the victory display: When earning experience during the resolution of this scenario, you earn additional experience equal to the attached card's level.

cards.flavor: Can't forgive yourself for it either.
cards.name: Can't Save Them All
cards.text: Revelation - Put Can't Save Them All into play in your threat area. Forced - When another investigator at your location takes damage or horror: Take 1 horror. [action][action][action]: Discard Can't Save Them All. As an additional cost to initiate this ability, you may exile a level 0-5 card from your hand to reduce its cost by [action][action].

cards.back_flavor: Valerie was always gifted, numbers are a second nature to her ever since she learnt how to count. She used to say she'd be a professor at Miskatonic someday, but that was just the first lie in a long line of them. These days, she makes her living under the low lights of La Bella Luna, turning probability into profit and watching the other patrons sweat. Math still speaks to her to this day, only that lately she's been thinking on algorithms she doesn't remember ever learning.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-3, Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 3 level 4-5 Seeker and/or Rogue cards ([seeker]/[rogue]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Hunch, Miscalculation, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Requirements: Your deck must contain at least 10 Seeker [seeker] and 10 Rogue [rogue] cards.
cards.flavor: "2 and a 7? Whatever shall I do!"
cards.name: Valerie Dalton
cards.text: [reaction] After you commit a Gambit card to a skill test: Ignore that card's printed text box (except for traits). Double that card's icons. (Limit once per round.) [reaction] After you commit a Practiced card to a skill test: Ignore that card's icons. Double that card's printed text box. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] effect: +0. You may now commit a card from your hand.

cards.flavor: Shut up! You're making me flush.
cards.name: Hunch
cards.text:
Valerie Dalton deck only. Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
When you commit Hunch, name a chaos token. If that token is revealed this skill test, after it resolves, draw a card, gain 3 resources, and immediately take an additional action.

cards.name: Miscalculation
cards.text: You must commit Miscalculation to each eligible skill test you perform, and perform either of Valerie's [reaction] abilities (ignoring all limits). This skill's icons subtract from your skill value instead of adding to it. You cannot ignore this paragraph. If you succeed, return Miscalculation to your hand and take 1 horror. If you fail, lose 3 resources.

cards.back_flavor: The Burke family has been cursed for generations. Laurie's unnatural connection to her ancestors allowed her to see and interact with the supernatural from a young age. Skills she turned into a very profitable career. Her abilities were a mystery to her, though. She always knew she could interact with the beyond, she just didn’t know why. It was only when she researched her family’s history in Miskatonic University’s Library that she uncovered the truth behind this matter… and realized someone had been waiting for her to find it.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-3, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 3 level 4-5 Seeker and/or Mystic cards ([seeker]/[mystic]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Prophetic Vision, Sir Nikolai Burke, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Requirements: Your deck must contain at least 10 Seeker [seeker] and 10 Mystic [mystic] cards.
cards.name: Laurie Burke
cards.text: Forced - When your turn begins: Seal (a random token). Forced - When you would reveal a token from the chaos bag while there are tokens sealed on Laurie Burke: Resolve all tokens sealed on her instead, then release them. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase, release any tokens sealed on Laurie Burke. [elder_sign] effect: +5. Seal (a random token).

cards.name: Prophetic Vision
cards.text: Laurie Burke deck only. Forced - After you reveal a chaos token during a skill test, if Prophetic Vision is ready, exhaust it: If you would... -... succeed by exactly 1 or 3, draw 1 card or gain 1 resource. -... succeed by exactly 2 or 4, replenish 1 charge or secret on an asset you control. -... fail by exactly 5, draw 3 cards, gain 5 resources, and you succeed instead. Remove Prophetic Vision from the game.

cards.name: Sir Nikolai Burke
cards.text: Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. Cannot be damaged except by Spell, Relic, or encounter cards. Sir Nikolai Burke gets +X fight, where X is the combined value of all sealed tokens. Revelation - Search the chaos bag for a [skull] token and seal it on Sir Nikolai Burke.

cards.back_flavor: Morris always had weird dreams. Like that one time he dreamt of the neighbour's house catching fire. Or that other time where the Essex train vanished without a trace, or even that one when the government seized Innsmouth for a week. All of which became real shortly after. For months now, his dream is always the same. He dreams of something sleeping, its awakening, and the doom of Arkham. With some luck, he will learn to interpret his dreams in time.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-3, Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 3 level 4-5 Seeker and/or Survivor cards ([seeker]/[survivor]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 3 copies of "I was right!", The End is Nigh, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Restrictions: Your deck must contain at least 10 Seeker [seeker] and 10 Survivor [survivor] cards.
cards.flavor: I've told you, I've told you all!
cards.name: Morris Robinson
cards.text: [reaction] When you would draw an encounter card: Name a Trait. If the drawn card has that Trait, discover 1 clue at your location. Otherwise, that card gains surge. (Limit once per phase.) [elder_sign] effect: +0. You may draw an encounter card to automatically succeed. You get +2 skill value while resolving revelation abilities on that card.

cards.name: "I was right!"
cards.text: Morris Robinson deck only. For each different Trait amongst cards in your threat area, choose a different one: - Deal 2 damage to an enemy at your location. - Draw. - Look at the top 4 cards of the encounter deck, and place them back in any order. - Move. - Play.

cards.flavor: You haven't thought what to do now.
cards.name: The End is Nigh
cards.text: Revelation - Name 3 different Traits, and then draw the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. For each Trait named you may discard 1 encounter card that shares that Trait instead of resolving its effects.

cards.back_flavor: If it can be sold, he's making profit out of it. Calibre big enough to kill someone inside a tank? Stolen Egyptian paraphernalia? Book that drives people mad? Sell it. Just don't get caught using it before. And if you do, make sure they can't tell nobody afterwards.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-3, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 3 level 4-5 Rogue and/or Mystic cards ([rogue]/[mystic]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Offer They Cannot Refuse, Overwhelmed, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Requirements: Your deck must contain at least 10 Rogue [rogue] and 10 Mystic [mystic] cards.
cards.flavor: "So, we have ourselves a deal?"
cards.name: Gianluca Vietti
cards.text: [free] During a skill test on an Illicit, Occult, Relic, Ritual, and/or Spell card, exhaust X (at least one) non-permanent assets with any of these other Traits: You get +X skill value for this test. If you succeed by 2 or more, ready an asset you control. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] effect: +2. If you succeed, you may ready an asset you control.

cards.flavor: "If you leave me the fuck alone, I won't ditch you in a pit, deal?"
cards.name: Offer They Cannot Refuse
cards.text: Evade ([willpower] or [agility]). Immediately before this evasion attempt, you may engage the evaded enemy. For each point you succeed by, ready an asset you control (to a maximum of 3).

cards.name: Overwhelmed
cards.text: Revelation - Put Overwhelmed into play in your play area. While Overwhelmed is ready, whenever you would succeed at a skill test, you succeed by 2 more and take 1 horror. While Overwhelmed is exhausted, you get -2 to all skills. [reaction] After you ready Overwhelmed outside of the upkeep phase: Discard it.

cards.back_flavor: Mabel has improved the Tick-Tock Club’s reputation the hard way, by pulling strings, smoothing egos, and making sure the right people walked through the door while the wrong ones stayed in La Bella Luna. When a string of disappearances traced back to patrons she personally invited, she couldn't help but to dig deeper until she found a pattern: every missing guest had been approached by the same sharply dressed stranger with the red gloves. Curious how not once of the people she interviewed remembers the man face, how his voice sounds, nor the smell of his perfume; everybody just fixated the gloves.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-3, Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 3 level 4-5 Rogue and/or Survivor cards ([rogue]/[survivor]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 2 copies of Cordial Invitation, Party's Over, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Requirements: Your deck must contain at least 10 Rogue [rogue] and 10 Survivor [survivor] cards.
cards.name: Mabel Roy
cards.text:
[reaction] After committing cards to another investigator's skill test, if their modified skill value for this test is less than half, or more than double its difficulty: Draw 1 card. You may choose to shuffle a copy of the drawn card from your discard pile into your deck. (Limit once per turn.)
[elder_sign] effect: +18.

cards.name: Cordial Invitation
cards.text:
Mabel Roy deck only.
Commit only to a skill test being performed by another investigator. This skill's icons may subtract from the skill value instead of adding to it.
Choose a card in the performing investigator's discard pile. After this test ends, they shuffle that card into their deck and draw 1 card.

cards.flavor: When they show up better be on your best behaviour.
cards.name: Party's Over
cards.text: Revelation - Put Party's Over into play in your threat area. [reaction] After you commit two or more cards to another investigator during their turn: Place 1 resource (from the token pool) on Party's Over. Forced - When the game ends, if Party's Over has fewer than 3 resources on it: You earn 2 fewer experience for this scenario.

cards.back_flavor: P.I. work ain’t easy. Even less so when you’re as thorough as Deshawn. He obsesses over every detail his clients provide, chasing the best path to reach his marks. For the most part, the method worked. Until this last gig. The details were so gruesome they gave even a professional like him nightmares, night after night. Still, Deshawn pressed on. He made a plan, and when he thought he finally had his mark cornered, he realized it was the other way around. He—it—was already hunting him, and had found him first
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-3, Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 3 level 4-5 Mystic and/or Survivor cards ([mystic]/[survivor]). Deckbuilding Restrictions: André Durant, Your Mark, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Requirements: Your deck must contain at least 10 Mystic [mystic] and 10 Survivor [survivor] cards.
cards.name: Deshawn Durant
cards.text:
[free] During a skill test on an asset you control without doom on it, place 1 doom on that asset: You get +2 skill value for this test.
[action] Exile a level 0-5 asset with doom on it: Resolve an [action] or [free] ability on that asset, ignoring all costs. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +4. You may remove doom from a player card to treat this as a -4 instead.

cards.name: André Durant
cards.text:
Deshawn Durant deck only. As an additional cost to play André Durant, place up to 3 doom among different assets you control.
For each doom placed as part of this card's cost you may heal 2 damage and/or horror from an investigator at your location, draw 1 card, or gain 2 resources.

cards.flavor: Each time you encounter your mark, he... it looks like it was already watching you for a while.
cards.name: Your Mark
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Hunter. Revelation - Secretly add this enemy to your hand. Forced - When an asset you control with doom on it would leave play: Spawn Your Mark engaged with you instead. Place 1 doom on that asset.

cards.name: Improvised Cover
cards.text:
Attach to your location. Playing Improvised Cover does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Improvised Cover may only be assigned damage and/or horror dealt by attacks of opportunity.
Any investigator may assign damage and/or horror to Improvised Cover only while at its location.

cards.name: Leave None Behind
cards.text:
Fast. Play when another investigator at your location is defeated. Attach that investigator's mini card to Leave None Behind. Damage must be assigned to Leave None Behind before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[reaction] When the game ends or you resign: That investigator is no longer considered defeated. Both you and that investigator earn 1 additional experience.

cards.flavor: "You'd be surprised what a good incense can do"
cards.name: Obscure Esoterica
cards.text: [free] During a skill test against a Monster enemy, exhaust Obscure Esoterica: Add your [willpower] value for this skill test.

cards.flavor: Step aside, or stepped over.
cards.name: Shove Aside
cards.text: Play only as your first action. Engage. Evade ([combat]). Choose an enemy at your location. Engage it, and evade it. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to that enemy.

cards.flavor: "Once you start seeing space behind the corners... The mind is too far gone."
cards.name: Irrational Thought
cards.text: Investigate ([intellect]). You get +1 or -1 [intellect] for this skill test. If you succeed by exactly the shroud of a connecting location, discover an additional clue at that location.

cards.name: "Just a peek!"
cards.text:
Fast. Play when you would draw a card from the encounter deck.
Reveal that card. If it is…
- ... an enemy: Replenish 1 evidence or secret on an asset you control
- ... a treachery: You may move to a connecting location.
- ... something else: Take 1 horror and draw 3 cards.

cards.flavor: Practice something enough and you'll do it with your eyes closed.
cards.name: Automation
cards.text: [reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by exactly 1 or 3, exhaust Automation: Return a Practiced skill you have committed that test to your hand.

cards.name: Dream-Enhancing Serum
cards.text: Only the first copy of each card in your hand counts toward your maximum hand size. [reaction] After you draw a copy of a card that is already in your hand, reveal both copies and exhaust Dream-Enhancing Serum: Either play one copy of that card (paying its cost), or draw 1 card.

cards.name: Piece by Piece
cards.text:
Myriad.
Deal 1 damage to an enemy engaged with you. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[reaction] After you play Piece by Piece: Play another Piece by Piece from your hand, at no cost.

cards.name: Hit
cards.text:
Commit only from your hand after revealing chaos tokens during a skill test you are performing on which you would succeed.
Reveal an additional chaos token. If you still succeed, gain 1 resource, draw 1 card, and ready an asset you control.

cards.name: Illicit Shipment
cards.text: [reaction] After you play Illicit Shipment: Attach up to 3 non-weakness Item or Supply cards from your hand facedown to Illicit Shipment. Draw 1 card for each card attached. Other investigators at your location may play any of those cards as if they were in their hand. Resources spent go to your resource pool.

cards.name: Up the Ante
cards.text:
Fast. Play after revealing chaos tokens during a skill test you are performing on which you would succeed.
Reveal an additional chaos token. If you still succeed, double the number of resources gained, cards drawn, clues discovered, damage/horror dealt and/or healed.

cards.name: Cursed Locket
cards.text: Fast. While Cursed Locket is ready, you get +1 [willpower] and -2 to each of your other skills. [free] Take 1 horror: Close it. Exhaust Cursed Locket.

cards.name: Obsidian Dagger
cards.text: [action] Exhaust Obsidian Dagger and place 1 doom on it: Fight ([combat]). You get +2 [combat] for each doom on Obsidian Dagger. [free] If Obsidian Dagger is ready and has 3 or more doom on it: Fight ([willpower]). This attack deals +2 damage. Discard Obsidian Dagger.

cards.flavor: "If you're here with us, give us a sign!"
cards.name: Consultation
cards.text: Commit only to a skill test during an investigation or parley attempt. If the test fails, place 1 doom on your investigator. After this test ends, draw 1 card.

cards.flavor: Beat fire with fire.
cards.name: Otherworldly Power
cards.text: After you commit Otherworldly Power to a skill test on an asset, for each doom on that asset Otherworldly Power gains [willpower] [wild].

cards.flavor: Roll up your sleeves and get to work
cards.name: Grit
cards.text: You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to activate [action] abilities printed on enemy or treachery cards.

cards.name: Old Equipment
cards.text: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase at deck creation. Earn 3 experience, which can only be spent on cards that exile. Between two scenarios of a campaign you must purchase cards you have exiled last scenario (if any) before you are able to purchase new cards.

cards.name: Workhorse
cards.text:
You may commit Workhorse to any type of skill test.
While Workhorse is committed to a skill test, that test gets +2 difficulty.
If this test is successful, the performing investigator draws 1 card and gains 2 resources.

cards.flavor: "The only way out is through."
cards.name: Fallback
cards.text: When you would exile a card, you may instead exile Fallback from your discard pile. (Consider any costs paid.)

cards.flavor: 50% of the work is recording it...
cards.name: Backup Files
cards.text:
Uses (0 backups).
[reaction] After you perform a non-move basic action: Place 1 resource on Backup Files.
[free] During your turn, spend 2 backups and exhaust Backup Files: Take a basic action.

cards.flavor: "Next one ain't going to the wall, pal."
cards.name: "Last Warning"
cards.text:
Fast. Play when you would defeat an enemy.
Discover 2 total clues from among your location and connecting locations instead.

cards.flavor: "Bone of the father, flesh of the servant, blood of the enemy..."
cards.name: Cleansing Ritual
cards.text: Attach to your location. All doom on non-Elite cards at your location does not count towards the agenda's doom threshold. Forced - When an investigator leaves attached location: Discard Cleansing Ritual.

cards.name: Altruism
cards.text:
Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round.
Resources on Altruism may be spent to pay for cards that mention "another/any investigator".
[free] During a skill test performed by another investigator at your location, spend 1 resource from Altruism: They get +1 skill value for this test.

cards.flavor: "Once you're warmed up... piece of cake."
cards.name: In the Zone
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate with this card committed to the test: Play this card (paying its cost). Choose and take two different basic actions of the following, in any order (move, evade, or investigate).

cards.flavor: "To bring something you must give something."
cards.name: Translocation
cards.text: Investigate ([willpower]). Investigate any revealed location in play. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] is revealed during this investigation, move one clue from the chosen location to your location. If you succeed, you may move to that location.

cards.flavor: "Once upon a..." No. That's complete shit.
cards.name: Trial and Error
cards.text: Limit 1 per investigator. You get +1 skill value against tests with at least one Trait you have already tried. [reaction] After you fail a skill test against a scenario card, exhaust Trial and Error: Choose a Trait on that card and remember that "you already tried [Trait]"

cards.name: Tesseract
cards.text: Exceptional. [action] Exhaust Tesseract: Test [agility] (3). If you have at least 5 [willpower] you get +2 [agility]. For each point you succeed by, Move (to a maximum of 3 times). [action] Ready Tesseract: Evade ([willpower]). If you have at least 5 [agility] you get +2 [willpower]. Target any enemy at your location or a connecting location.

cards.flavor: "C'me on. You know how to do it!"
cards.name: "Now do it like you really want it"
cards.text:
Fast. Play after another investigator at your location fails a skill test by 2 or more.
They attempt that test again. If they don't succeed by 2 or more, move 1 resource from their resource pile to yours.

cards.flavor: Just be sure not to spread it.
cards.name: Welcome Evil
cards.text: Move 1 doom from the agenda to an asset you control. Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, place 1 doom on your investigator. Remove Welcome Evil from the game.
